results.title: Force of evil
results.creator_credit: Abraham Polonsky, Bob Roberts, Enterprise Studios and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: John Garfield gives one of his most outstanding performances as the successful Wall Street lawyer Joe Morse who has made his considerable fortune out of petty corruption and looking after the interests of the gambling underworld. When big-time racketeer Ben Tucker (Roy Roberts) gets Joe to assist him in controlling the New York numbers game, Joe has to put the career and life of his own brother, Leo (Thomas Gomez), in jeopardy. This forces Joe into having to decide between the seduction of big money and loyalty to his brother. From this minimalist film-noir plot, Polonsky has fashioned a dark fable about the American Dream. Notable also for being one of the first Hollywood films to use location street shots, the imposing skyscrapers and the depressing tenement slums of New York City add layers of visual meaning to the film, further drawing connections between good and evil, morality and criminality, poverty and wealth. Polonsky’s and Garfield’s careers were to be destroyed by the McCarthy political witch-hunts, particularly when they refused to betray their friends in the show-trials for the House of Un-American Activities. “Force of Evil”, and it’s critical examination of wealth and power in urban America was used as evidence of their Communist leanings. The film is based on the novel “Tucker’s People” by Ira Wolfert.

results.title: The Phantom tollbooth
results.creator_credit: Abe Levitow, Chuck Jones and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A young boy, (Butch Patrick) dreams away his boredom by entering an animated fantasy world which he enters by driving through the Phantom Tollbooth. In this world letters and numbers are at war with one another, and the boy must rescue two Princesses, Rhyme and Reason who have been exiled to a castle hovering in the sky. Based on Norton Juster’s book, this film is MGM’s first full-length feature cartoon. Voices provided by Mel Blanc, June Foray and Daws Butler

results.title: Straford video memories
results.creator_credit: Frank Straford, John Straford and Inala Video
results.brief_description:
Video memories of the Victorian west coast and bushfires in the north-east produced by the Straford family.
“Gone to blazes” contains footage broadcast by national and commercial TV channels during the course of the devastating bushfires that ravaged the Victorian north-east early in 2003.

results.title: Gum preparation, stone flaking etc; (Episode 2)
results.creator_credit: Ian Dunlop and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “People of the Australian Western Desert (A)”
Scenes typical of the daily life of nomadic First Nations people of the Pintubi tribe in desert conditions, filmed in the Clutterbuck Hills area, Western Australia. Gum preparation, stone flaking, Djagamara leave Badjar.

results.title: Seed cake making and general camp activity
results.creator_credit: Ian Dunlop and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “People of the Australian Western Desert (A)”
Scenes typical of the daily life of nomadic First Nations people of the Pintubi tribe in desert conditions, filmed in the Clutterbuck Hills area, Western Australia. The women of the family group gather grass seed. Back in camp, surrounded by their family they make seed cake.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 050
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The following items are featured in this interesting cinemagazine: a self-taught sculptor makes First Nations people the subject of his work; a Child Welfare Centre is a boon in New Guinea; plastic bowls show they run true to form and a history of duelling through the ages is shown.

results.title: Australian diary. No. 005
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: This cinemagazine features the following items: swimming instruction classes in New South Wales; problems with traffic in Melbourne; First Nations people show their skill with the stockwhip; Sulman architectural awards and strange animals at the Melbourne Zoo.

results.title: Art of the hunter
results.brief_description: Shows First Nations people making weapons, hunting, cooking and painting on bark. Also shows some rare cave paintings. Filmed in the Northern Territory near Darwin.
